newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ING'S INSURANCE ARM 1996 PROFIT UP 12 PCT.
newsitem.headline: ING'S INSURANCE ARM 1996 PROFIT UP 12 PCT.

text.p: Nationale-Nederlanden, the insurance arm of the Internationale Nederlanden Group (ING), said on Thursday its 1996 net profit had risen by 12 percent to 802 million guilders.
It added that its car insurance activities had generated a profit of 25 million guilders, the first positive result of this sector in years.

Total gross premium income grew by 443 million guilders to 8.7 billion. Nationale-Nederlanden said mortgage activities were its main growth market in 1996 with a total lending portfolio now at more than 20 billion guilders.
The production of new mortgages grew by 60 percent last year, it added.
Earlier this month, parent company ING reported its total 1996 group net profit had risen to 3.32 billion guilders from 2.65 billion in 1995.
